TITLE: Statins vs. supplements: New study finds one is 'vastly superior' to cut cholesterol
SUMMARY: Millions of people are prescribed statins to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart disease, but many would rather take supplements instead. A new study shows statins are much more effective.

TITLE: Elon Musk threatens to boot Twitter account impersonators
SUMMARY: Twitter's new owner warned of suspending accounts after some celebrities tweeted as 'Elon Musk' in reaction to the billionaire's decision to offer verified accounts for a fee.

TITLE: A total lunar eclipse is happening Tuesday — and it won't happen again for 3 years
SUMMARY: A total lunar eclipse happens when the moon falls completely in the Earth's shadow.

TITLE: FAQ: What's at stake at the COP27 global climate negotiations
SUMMARY: World leaders are meeting in Egypt for the next two weeks to talk about reining in climate change and paying for its deadly effects. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Why a Southern California congressional race hinges on Asian American voters
SUMMARY: A congressional race in Orange County has become one of the most closely watched contests this election cycle, and will likely trigger a rethink for politicos on how Asian Americans vote.

TITLE: Here are the places where abortion is on the ballot (in one way or another) this week
SUMMARY: Abortion is on the ballot in California, Kentucky, Michigan, Montana and Vermont, but it's also playing a major role in races for governor, attorney general and state supreme courts nationwide.

TITLE: Extreme kayaking on North Carolina's Green Narrows draws thousands of spectators
SUMMARY: The only way to watch the Green Race kayak race in North Carolina is to hike down a two-mile steep ravine - a trek so strenuous that it parallels the vertical waterfalls the kayakers embark in.

TITLE: 100 years after unearthing King Tut's tomb, archaeologists make new discoveries
SUMMARY: Uncovered coffins, papyrus documents and other artifacts have recently been found at the Saqqara site in Giza, Egypt. It coincides with a new accusation that jewelry was stolen from the site.

TITLE: Be patient: This election is probably going to go on a while
SUMMARY: Election Day is Tuesday, but expect this election to go on a while. Close races, rules changes and a conspiratorial environment all may lead to delays.

TITLE: For the first time in about 70 years, Detroit won't have a Black Democrat in Congress
SUMMARY: Detroiters could elect a Black Republican to the U.S. House. But GOP candidates face a skeptical voting bloc in the Democratic stronghold.

TITLE: Politicians need to mobilize Black male voters ahead of the midterms, experts say
SUMMARY: Just like with any voting bloc, there's still a vast array of diverging opinions, ideologies and issues that are important among Black voters in races.

TITLE: The U.N. chief tells the climate summit: Cooperate or perish
SUMMARY: Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warning that the world is "on a highway to climate hell" and urged the two biggest polluting countries, China and the United States, to work together to avert it.

TITLE: Elon Musk targets impersonators on Twitter after celebrities troll him
SUMMARY: Twitter's new owner warned of suspending accounts after some celebrities tweeted as 'Elon Musk' in reaction to the billionaire's decision to offer verified accounts for a fee.

TITLE: Stewart Rhodes denies he organized the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol
SUMMARY: He testified that the attack was "nowhere in the mission scope at all" of his group called the Oath Keepers. He and four other members are charged with seditious conspiracy.

TITLE: Oath Keepers' Stewart Rhodes denies he organized the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol
SUMMARY: He testified that the attack was "nowhere in the mission scope at all" of his group, He and four other members are charged with seditious conspiracy.

TITLE: Oklahoma City Zoo welcomed its first lion cubs in 15 years. You can help name them
SUMMARY: Dunia, a 7-year-old African lion, gave birth to three females and one male in September. Fans can vote for one of three groups of names on the zoo's website until Monday at midnight.

TITLE: In southern Ukraine, Kherson residents live in fear — and hope — as battle looms
SUMMARY: Those who've left Kherson and others who still have loved ones there describe a community in fear of the Russian occupiers — and hopeful that increased shelling means the Ukrainians are coming.

TITLE: Ukraine updates: Iran admits sending Russia drones as electricity knocked out (Nov. 7)
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: An Iowa teen convicted of killing her rapist escapes from a probation center
SUMMARY: Pieper Lewis, who was a 15-year-old sex trafficking victim at the time she stabbed her abuser, could face 20 years in prison if her sentence is reimposed.

TITLE: A tight congressional race in Oregon could signal the breadth of the GOP's reach
SUMMARY: The contest in Oregon's new 6th Congressional District, once a blue stronghold, was recently rated a "toss-up" amid GOP gains.

TITLE: Inside a Michigan clinic, patients talk about abortion — and a looming statewide vote
SUMMARY: Michigan faces a key vote on abortion rights as patients travel there from other states. At a clinic near Detroit, many women share what abortion access means for their own lives and futures.

TITLE: At Guinea's only specialized snake bite clinic, doctors need luck and antivenom
SUMMARY: Life or death in this country's only specialized clinic depends on how fast people can make the arduous trip to get there and the number of doses on hand.

TITLE: How racism and discrimination plagued Black Americans serving in WWII
SUMMARY: Though more than a million Black Americans contributed to the war effort, historian Matthew Delmont says a uniform was no protection from racism at home or abroad. His new book is <em>Half American.

TITLE: A hurricane watch is issued for Florida as Subtropical Storm Nicole gathers strength
SUMMARY: Officials urged Floridians to "not focus on the exact track" of the storm, which is hundreds of miles across. The unusual, late-season storm could reach Category 1 hurricane strength later this week.

TITLE: Could this cheaper, more climate-friendly perennial rice transform farming?
SUMMARY: A promising, less labor-intensive perennial rice is beginning to take off in China, but whether this success can be replicated in other crops like wheat or corn remains to be seen.

TITLE: As Netanyahu forms Israeli government, U.S. may boycott one of his far-right allies
SUMMARY: As the former Israeli prime minister returns to power, he's expected to give a post to a politician once convicted of inciting racism — whom the Biden administration might choose not to engage with.

TITLE: Inflation is top issue in this week's midterms
SUMMARY: Rising prices are a top concern for voters in this year's midterm elections, outpacing abortion, crime and defending democracy. Prices in September were up 8.2% from a year ago.

TITLE: Here's what happened today at the U.N.'s COP27 climate negotiations
SUMMARY: A new early warning system for weather disasters, calls for wealthy nations and corporations to pay up and dire descriptions of human suffering. Here's what happened at COP27 today.

TITLE: NHL team yanks contract of a player who bullied a Black classmate with disabilities
SUMMARY: It's the second time Mitchell Miller's path to the NHL has been abruptly blocked. The mother of the student who was abused tells NPR that her son is still struggling.

TITLE: Monday's Powerball lottery drawing has been delayed due to security protocols
SUMMARY: Monday night's Powerball drawing has been delayed, as one participating lottery needs more time to carry out security procedures, lottery officials said.

TITLE: Chris Evans named Sexiest Man Alive by People magazine
SUMMARY: People magazine named <em>Captain America

TITLE: In Washington state, controversial ties and rhetoric are upending a House race
SUMMARY: The Washington congressional race has highlighted how heated political divisions have become politics as usual in this year's midterms.

TITLE: Your election night guide, hour-by-hour
SUMMARY: It all comes down to this. After months of campaigning, ups and down, Election Day is here. Here's what to watch, as the night unfolds.

TITLE: Supreme Court considers fate of landmark Indian adoption law
SUMMARY: At issue is whether the the Indian Child Welfare Act — aimed at preventing Native American children from being separated from their tribes — is tribal protection or racial classification.

TITLE: Still reeling from Ian, Florida shrimpers are desperate to get back on the water
SUMMARY: Fishers in southwest Florida are desperate to save their shrimping fleet, and their lifestyle, decimated by Hurricane Ian more than a month ago.

TITLE: New VA study finds Paxlovid may cut the risk of long COVID
SUMMARY: For those at high risk, Pfizer's antiviral drug helps stave off severe COVID-19. Now research suggests it may also reduce their chances of long COVID.

TITLE: Six races for governor that could make history this midterm election
SUMMARY: The majority of U.S. politicians are white men. This cycle, some states are poised to make history by electing female, LGBTQ, or Black governors for the first time.

TITLE: 'We are the future': Meet first-time voters supporting Republicans this cycle
SUMMARY: Young conservative voters aren't a monolith. They have different policy priorities and different views on what role former President Trump should play in the Republican Party.

TITLE: Why mail voting laws may slow the count in some key swing states
SUMMARY: Some states, like Pennsylvania, may be slower to report election results because of laws that don't allow officials to start preparing mail ballots for counting until Election Day.

TITLE: It's going to be hard for Biden to meet this $11 billion climate change promise
SUMMARY: President Biden has pledged to quadruple the annual U.S. contribution to international climate aid to $11 billion. He has a long, tough road to get there.

TITLE: A Polish leader's comments about women and alcohol use draw an instant backlash
SUMMARY: The comments by governing party leader Jaroslaw Kaczynski that tied women's alcohol consumption to low birthrates quickly drew criticism from opposition politicians, activists and celebrities.

TITLE: They made a material that doesn't exist on Earth. That's only the start of the story.
SUMMARY: A scientific discovery could forever change China and the U.S. industrial balance.

TITLE: FIFA's former leader says making Qatar a World Cup host was a mistake
SUMMARY: Blatter, who has long said he voted for the United States, made the admission in his first major interview since being acquitted in July of financial misconduct at FIFA.

TITLE: It's not yet clear if anyone won Monday's delayed $2 billion Powerball drawing
SUMMARY: The Powerball drawing was delayed after one participating lottery needed more time to carry out security procedures. If there is no winner, the jackpot will grow larger still.

TITLE: Travel diary: Tracking climate, migration and the far-right from Africa to Europe
SUMMARY: Welcome to the travel blog for the NPR project that examined how the ripples of climate change radiate outward.

TITLE: Did someone win $2 billion? The results of today's Powerball drawing are unclear
SUMMARY: The Powerball drawing was delayed after one participating lottery needed more time to carry out security procedures. If there is no winner, the jackpot will grow larger still.

TITLE: Stories about crime are rife with misinformation and racism, critics say
SUMMARY: We've heard again and again that crime is rising. But the reality is far more complex, in part because of how we define crime in the first place.

TITLE: Maricopa County says 20% of polling places have equipment issues but votes are fine
SUMMARY: Officials say the votes will still be counted, thanks to their redundancy protocols, but the machine malfunctions were quickly used by right-leaning influencers to fuel claims of fraud.

TITLE: Arizona's Maricopa County says it's identified a solution for voting equipment issues
SUMMARY: The issues with the tabulators were quickly used by right-leaning influencers to fuel claims of fraud.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Nicole churns toward the Bahamas and Florida
SUMMARY: The storm is expected to strengthen into a hurricane. It's headed for parts of the Bahamas and Florida that are still feeling the effects of previous hurricanes.

TITLE: Listen: 2022 Election Night Special Coverage
SUMMARY: Millions have already voted and results are coming in. Listen to NPR election night analysis beginning at 8 p.m. ET.

TITLE: Maxwell Frost elected as the first Gen Z member of Congress
SUMMARY: Maxwell Frost came to national attention as one of the first members of Generation Z to launch a bid for Congress. At 25, he just meets the minimum age to serve in the House of Representatives.

TITLE: Florida Sen. Marco Rubio wins reelection, keeping the seat for the GOP
SUMMARY: Rubio defeated Democratic Rep. Val Demings.

TITLE: Republican Ron DeSantis wins reelection as Florida's Governor
SUMMARY: DeSantis's victory over Democrat Charlie Crist gives him a second term and a national platform as he eyes a potential run for the 2024 Republican Presidential nomination.

TITLE: Democrat Wes Moore elected governor in historic Maryland race
SUMMARY: Wes Moore is the third Black governor to be elected in the country, and the first to serve in Maryland. He defeated Republican Dan Cox for the job, who was endorsed by former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Trump-backed J.D. Vance wins Senate seat in Ohio over Democrat Tim Ryan
SUMMARY: They were competing for the seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Rob Portman, who is retiring. Vance rose to prominence after writing the memoir <em>Hillbilly Elegy

TITLE: Vermont ends streak as the last state to send a woman to Congress
SUMMARY: Vermont was the last state to have never sent a woman to Congress. But on Tuesday, Democrat Becca Balint won her race, and will become the first woman and first LGBTQ person to represent the state.

TITLE: Republican Gov. Brian Kemp wins second term in Georgia over Democrat Stacey Abrams
SUMMARY: Republican Gov. Brian Kemp, Georgia's incumbent governor, clinches win over Democrat Stacey Abrams.

TITLE: Josh Shapiro secures Pa. governor's office, beating election-denier Doug Mastriano
SUMMARY: Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro wins Pennsylvania race for governor beating Trump-backed Republican Doug Mastriano.

TITLE: Republican Ted Budd takes North Carolina Senate seat, beating Democrat Cheri Beasley
SUMMARY: Budd was a relatively unknown congressman before former President Donald Trump weighed in, backing him last June. A Democrat hasn't won a senate election in the state since 2008.

TITLE: Democrat Maggie Hassan keeps Senate seat in New Hampshire, beating GOP's Don Bolduc
SUMMARY: Hassan ran as someone who embraced bipartisanship and abortion rights. Bolduc initially pushed but then backed away from Trump's false claim that the 2020 election was stolen.

TITLE: California voters reject measures to legalize sports betting
SUMMARY: Proposition 26 would have legalized sports betting at tribal casinos, while allowing them to also offer craps and roulette. Proposition 27 would have approved online and mobile sports betting.

TITLE: James Roesener is the first out trans man elected to a U.S. state legislature
SUMMARY: James Roesener, 26, is the first openly trans man elected to a state legislature in U.S. history, per the LGBTQ Victory Fund. It says a record number of trans candidates ran in the 2022 midterms.

TITLE: Democrat John Fetterman beats Trump-backed Dr. Oz in Pennsylvania Senate race
SUMMARY: The seat, which flips from Republican to Democrat, was vacated by retiring GOP Sen. Pat Toomey.

TITLE: California voters enshrine right to abortion and contraception in state constitution
SUMMARY: Proposition 1 was a direct response to the <em>Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization

TITLE: Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer wins reelection in Michigan
SUMMARY: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer wins race for governor over Republican Tudor Dixon.

TITLE: Overall, voting in the U.S. today was ... uneventful
SUMMARY: In an election that had experts worried about vigilante poll monitors and the potential for danger for election workers, voting on Election Day seems to have gone off without any major incidents.

TITLE: See what Election Day looked like around the country
SUMMARY: For the midterm races, photographers at NPR member stations documented what happened leading up to  Election Day. Take a look at what they saw.

TITLE: U.S. basketball star Brittney Griner has been sent to a Russian penal colony
SUMMARY: Griner has been moved from a detention center outside of Moscow and is being sent to a Russian penal colony to begin serving out her nine-year sentence on drug smuggling charges, her lawyers said.

TITLE: Michigan voters approve amendment adding reproductive rights to state constitution
SUMMARY: The vote effectively scraps a 1931 state ban on the procedure that could have taken effect following the U.S. Supreme Court's overturning of <em>Roe v. Wade.

TITLE: Investors have trillions to fight climate change. Developing nations get little of it
SUMMARY: Private investment is crucial to addressing climate change. But a big barrier to private investment in developing countries is the perception that risks are higher than in industrialized nations.

TITLE: Investments of 125 billionaires have the same carbon footprint as France, study finds
SUMMARY: Researchers at Oxfam, a nonprofit devoted to combating poverty, examined billionaires who collectively own $2.4 trillion in company equity, with investments across 183 companies.

TITLE: 6 takeaways from an election night that's not over yet
SUMMARY: These midterm elections show why it's always important to never assume you know exactly what's going to happen in advance – and to keep an open mind for potential surprises.

TITLE: 'Vogue' sues rappers Drake and 21 Savage over fake magazine cover promoting new album
SUMMARY: Condé Nast, the publisher of Vogue, is seeking at least $4 million in damages over the rappers' fake Vogue

TITLE: Cornell suspends frat parties after reports of drugged drinks and sexual assault
SUMMARY: The suspension comes after reports of several students drugged between September and November and a sexual assault reported over the weekend.

TITLE: Dozens of SAT tests have been lost after flying out of an El Paso UPS truck
SUMMARY: El Paso High School students' SAT answer sheets flew from the UPS truck transporting them last week. All but 55 were recovered, and students may have to retake their tests.

TITLE: Voting was largely uneventful despite fears of intimidation and conspiracies
SUMMARY: In an election that had experts worried about vigilante poll monitors and the potential for danger for election workers, voting on Election Day seems to have gone off without any major incidents.

TITLE: Facebook parent company Meta sheds 11,000 jobs in latest sign of tech slowdown
SUMMARY: The layoffs represent the first large-scale workforce reduction in the company's 18-year history.

TITLE: Live: 2022 election updates and results
SUMMARY: Nov. 8 was the final voting day of the 2022 election, with key Senate, House and gubernatorial races on the line. Follow NPR's live coverage.

TITLE: 6 takeaways from the 2022 midterm election that's not over yet
SUMMARY: These midterm elections show why it's always important to never assume you know exactly what's going to happen in advance – and to keep an open mind for potential surprises.

TITLE: How Bangladesh went from an economic miracle to needing IMF help
SUMMARY: Millions emerged from poverty in recent decades. But now, rising fuel prices, weak exports and scant remittances are sabotaging growth, and Bangladesh asked the IMF for $4.5 billion in loans.

TITLE: Kentucky voters reject amendment that would have affirmed no right to abortion
SUMMARY: Amendment 2 would have added language to the state constitution rejecting a right to abortion, effectively leaving the question to Kentucky's Republican-controlled legislature.

TITLE: Where abortion was on the ballot, midterm voters largely signaled support
SUMMARY: Voters in several states were asked to weigh in on ballot measures specifically related to abortion rights.

TITLE: 'Fatty Fatty Boom Boom' details podcaster's battle with weight
SUMMARY: Atypical of inspirational weight-loss books, <em>Fatty Fatty Boom Boom

TITLE: Meditation works as well as a popular drug to reduce anxiety, study finds
SUMMARY: Researchers compared a practice of daily mindfulness meditation to taking Lexapro to control anxiety symptoms. The meditators got equivalent relief, without the side effects.

TITLE: Americans with disabilities need an updated long-term care plan, say advocates
SUMMARY: Nearly 75% of Americans with disabilities live with a family caregiver, many of them age 60 or older. Updating your care plan now, experts say, can help make sure everyone thrives.

TITLE: Amid vaccine shortages, Lebanon faces its first cholera outbreak in three decades
SUMMARY: Several crises in the country — including political instability, COVID and financial collapse — have created deteriorating conditions that have allowed the bacteria to spread.

TITLE: Democrat Jocelyn Benson is reelected as Michigan secretary of state
SUMMARY: Benson defeated Kristina Karamo, an election denier who made a name for herself claiming without evidence she saw fraud in the 2020 election.

TITLE: In a setback for Putin, Russia says it's withdrawing from a key city in south Ukraine
SUMMARY: The city of Kherson, which Russian forces captured on the second day of their invasion of Ukraine is on the verge of returning to Ukrainian control.

TITLE: Kansas voters reelect Democratic Gov. Laura Kelly over GOP challenger Derek Schmidt
SUMMARY: After an extremely tight election, Democrat Laura Kelly, governor of Kansas, wins four more years in offer over her Republican challenger Kelly held off Republican challenger Derek Schmidt.

TITLE: Voters approved more money for affordable housing around the country
SUMMARY: Skyrocketing rents and home prices have been a major part of voters' economic pain. New spending will go toward building  and subsidizing more housing, and helping people avoid homelessness.

TITLE: GOP Sen. Ron Johnson is reelected, defeating Democrat Mandela Barnes in Wisconsin
SUMMARY: Johnson's seat was once considered to be one of the most vulnerable for the GOP this cycle.

TITLE: Russia says it's withdrawing from the key city of Kherson, but Ukraine is skeptical
SUMMARY: Russia announced a withdrawal from Kherson, Ukraine, but the Ukrainian government said there's "no signs" Russian forces left without a fight.

TITLE: A Russian-appointed official died in a car crash in Ukraine's Kherson
SUMMARY: Born in Ukraine, Kirill Stremousov had switched to Russia's side and mimicked its lies about Nazi rule, becoming spokesman and deputy governor of the Moscow-installed administration in Kherson.

TITLE: Sen. Raphael Warnock and Herschel Walker are going to a runoff in Georgia
SUMMARY: Neither candidate was above the 50% threshold needed to win outright under Georgia law. This sets up a post-Thanksgiving showdown in what is already the country's most expensive Senate race.

TITLE: Biden set to hold a press conference on midterm elections results
SUMMARY: President Biden will hold a press conference on the heels of a better-than-expected performance by Democrats in the 2022 midterms.

TITLE: Universal free lunch ballot measure passes easily in Colorado
SUMMARY: Colorado voters approved a ballot measure to provide free meals for all public school students.

TITLE: Biden cheers Democrats for avoiding a 'red wave' in the midterm elections
SUMMARY: "I'm prepared to work with my Republican colleagues," the president said in remarks from the White House on Wednesday. He also said he intends to run for reelection.

TITLE: Florida braces for Hurricane Nicole, a rare November storm
SUMMARY: The storm strengthened into a hurricane on Wednesday after pounding the Bahamas, as U.S. officials ordered evacuations that included former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago club.

TITLE: What is a runoff election? Let's break down what's happening in Georgia
SUMMARY: The race between Georgia incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican Herschel Walker is too close to call and will go to a runoff election this December. What does that mean?

TITLE: Rep. Kevin McCarthy has announced his bid for House Speaker
SUMMARY: House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy has officially announced his intention to run for Speaker of the House.

TITLE: A day after Election Day, here's where things stand
SUMMARY: We're now in the post-Election Day phase of election season — with House and Senate control unknown. Here's what we know — and don't know — about some key races.

TITLE: Hurricane Nicole is expected to make landfall on the Florida coast Wednesday
SUMMARY: The storm is leaving the Bahamas and was about 75 miles from West Palm Beach, Florida as of Wednesday evening, the National Hurricane Center said.

TITLE: CMA Awards honor Loretta Lynn while Luke Combs wins album of the year
SUMMARY: The Country Music Association held its annual awards on Wednesday night by having some of the genre's biggest stars pay tribute to the late country queen Loretta Lynn.

TITLE: Deli meats and cheeses have been linked to a listeria outbreak in 6 states
SUMMARY: A listeria outbreak has led to 16 infections and one death across six states, with New York having the most cases. The CDC has not yet pinpointed specific products that could be causing the outbreak.

TITLE: Nicole makes landfall in Florida as a Category 1 hurricane
SUMMARY: Hurricane Nicole made landfall early Thursday along the east coast of Florida, battering a large area of the state still recovering from Hurricane Ian.

TITLE: How the $2 billion Powerball jackpot winner should protect their newfound wealth
SUMMARY: Winning the lottery is a dream to many. But if you were to possess a winning lottery ticket in reality, experts say there are a number of things you should do to protect yourself.

TITLE: The midterms went better than expected for Biden. Now he's traveling to Asia
SUMMARY: President Biden leaves Thursday for a series of major summits with foreign leaders. And in Bali, he'll meet face-to-face with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

TITLE: A transgender beauty influencer was put in a men's jail after her arrest in Miami
SUMMARY: The incarceration of trans woman Nikita Dragun in a men's jail is part of a much wider trend of transgender individuals being placed in jails and prisons that don't align with their gender identity.

TITLE: As Harvard's endowment abandons fossil fuels, oil-rich University of Texas catches up
SUMMARY: Royalties on oil and natural gas, along with lease payments on millions of acres of land, are helping the University of Texas, which is in second place, narrow the gap with Harvard.

TITLE: Some Twitter users flying the coop hope Mastodon will be a safe landing
SUMMARY: Now that Elon Musk owns Twitter, some of the social network's users are looking for alternatives. One that's ballooned in the past two weeks is Mastodon.

TITLE: Rising prices are on the menu for Thanksgiving this year
SUMMARY: With Thanksgiving just two weeks away, food and family are on many people's minds. But turkey and travel will carry a hefty price tag this year, in another sign of high inflation.

TITLE: Here are 3 dangerous climate tipping points the world is on track for
SUMMARY: Global leaders are negotiating about how to cut greenhouse gas emissions as quickly as possible. Scientists say every passing day, and every tenth of a degree, makes a big difference.

TITLE: Nicole weakens to a tropical storm after reaching Florida's east coast
SUMMARY: Nicole was downgraded to a tropical storm Thursday morning, shortly after making landfall in Florida, officials at the National Hurricane Center said.

TITLE: More older Americans become homeless as inflation rises and housing costs spike
SUMMARY: In Montana and across the nation, homeless shelters report the worrisome trend that seniors are a growing proportion of their residents.

TITLE: Uganda ends school year early as it tries to contain growing Ebola outbreak
SUMMARY: Since the outbreak began in September, eight children have died — and there is no approved vaccine. But doctors are hopeful that public health measures may be enough to stop the spread.

TITLE: Live: 2022 election updates and results
SUMMARY: Nov. 8 was the final voting day of the 2022 election. Key Senate, House and gubernatorial races are on the line. Follow NPR's live coverage and results as they come in.

TITLE: 'Vogue' has 'an easy case' in lawsuit against Drake and 21 Savage, experts say
SUMMARY: The magazine's publisher is suing the two Grammy award-winning artists for releasing a parody <em>Vogue

TITLE: After Election Day, here's where things stand
SUMMARY: We're now in the post-Election Day phase of election season — with House and Senate control unknown. Here's what we know — and don't know — about some key races.

TITLE: Italy has been a strong supporter of Ukraine — but that is starting to change
SUMMARY: Though Italy's new prime minister vows to continue the country's staunch support for Ukraine, much of the public is critical of Italian weapons deliveries and analysts say the government may waver.

TITLE: Rising prices are on the menu for Thanksgiving, with inflation currently at 7.7%
SUMMARY: With Thanksgiving just two weeks away, food and family are on many people's minds. But turkey and travel will carry a hefty price tag this year. The annual inflation rate in October was 7.7%.

TITLE: Workers at HarperCollins Publishers begin strike
SUMMARY: Unionized workers at one of the largest publishing companies in the country started an indefinite strike today. They are asking for better pay and a stronger commitment to diversity from the company.

TITLE: A Pussy Riot member describes what Brittney Griner can expect in Russian penal colony
SUMMARY: Maria Alyokhina was sent to a penal colony as a member of the feminist punk collective. Authorities "teach you how to forget your right to choose," she says. She urges Griner "to not forget yourself."

TITLE: Inflation cools in October and stocks rally on signs the pain of high prices may ease
SUMMARY: Consumer prices in October were up 7.7% from a year ago. That's a slower pace of inflation than September's rate of 8.2%. And price hikes between September and October were smaller than expected.

TITLE: A man has been charged in connection with a threat to synagogues in New Jersey
SUMMARY: An 18-year-old is accused of posting a broad online threat that spurred heightened security at Jewish synagogues and schools in New Jersey.

TITLE: After wins at the ballot, abortion rights groups want to 'put this to the people'
SUMMARY: Victories in several states this year have abortion rights advocates looking at where they can next take the fight directly to voters.

TITLE: Democrat Eric Sorensen's win keeps Illinois House seat with Democrats
SUMMARY: Former TV weatherman Eric Sorensen has won the Illinois House seat being vacated by fellow Democrat Cheri Bustos, defeating Republican challenger Esther Joy King.

TITLE: A new climate reality is taking shape as renewables become widespread
SUMMARY: <em>New York Times

TITLE: Montana voters reject so-called 'Born Alive' ballot measure
SUMMARY: Montana voters rejected a referendum proponents said was necessary to protect survivors of botched abortions. Opponents called it redundant to infanticide laws already on the books.

TITLE: What Russia's announced pullout from Kherson means for the war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russia says it's withdrawing from Kherson to the east bank of the Dnipro River. Here's what it means for the war in Ukraine.

TITLE: Stock market surges after inflation report shows the pain of high prices may ease
SUMMARY: The Dow rose more than 3% after a report showed that consumer prices in October were up 7.7% from a year ago. That's a slower pace of inflation than September's rate of 8.2%.

TITLE: Russia is retreating, so why is the U.S. nudging Ukraine to compromise?
SUMMARY: Russia says it's withdrawing from the southern city of Kherson, but Ukraine says it's not seeing a pullout. Meanwhile, the Biden administration is asking Ukraine to show a willingness to negotiate.

TITLE: LA County drops charges against election software executive, citing 'potential bias'
SUMMARY: The abrupt reversal of charges marks the end of a case that prominent election deniers cited as evidence of foul play in American elections.

TITLE: Tina Kotek is Oregon's new governor, continuing Democrats' rule
SUMMARY: Kotek, a former state House speaker, beat out Republican Christine Drazan, a former state lawmaker. The race was uncomfortably close for Democrats who've held the governor's mansion for four decades.

TITLE: A Texas judge strikes down Biden's student loan-forgiveness plan
SUMMARY: District Court Judge Mark Pittman, an appointee of former President Donald Trump based in Fort Worth, said the program usurped Congress' power to make laws.

TITLE: Tropical Depression Nicole causes problems as it moves through Georgia
SUMMARY: The storm could dump as much as 6 inches of rain over the Blue Ridge Mountains, forecasters say. Flooding is possible as the rain spreads into the eastern Ohio Valley, Mid-Atlantic and New England.

TITLE: Washington Commanders owner and NFL are among those sued by D.C.'s attorney general
SUMMARY: The group sued by the District of Columbia is accused of colluding to deceive fans by lying about an inquiry into "sexual misconduct and a persistently hostile work environment" within the team.

TITLE: Are climate change emissions finally going down? Definitely not
SUMMARY: World leaders are discussing how to get climate change under control, but new reports show the post-pandemic rebound and war in Ukraine are driving emissions even higher.

TITLE: It turns out that chimpanzees and gorillas can form lasting friendships
SUMMARY: Two decades of research in Nouabalé-Ndoki Park in the Republic of Congo found the primates foraging alongside each other, wrestling, seeking out their pals — and occasionally making threats.

TITLE: Anxious while awaiting election results? Here are expert tips to help you cope
SUMMARY: Kate Sweeny, who studies the psychology of waiting, says it's normal to stress about uncertainty. Her suggestions for coping include changing your mindset, taking action and finding deep distraction.

TITLE: These 12 restaurants are offering discounts on Veterans Day
SUMMARY: Dozens of companies across the U.S. are offering freebies and discounts to veterans and active-duty military members on Veterans Day.

TITLE: How an Air Force unit looked out for their own, even after she left the service
SUMMARY: When Jessica Israelsen left the Air Force, it was not an easy decision. She was going through a difficult time, and even though she wasn't part of the unit, her team kept looking out for her.

TITLE: The Democrats' strategy of boosting far-right candidates seems to have worked
SUMMARY: Back in the primary season, a number of Democrats tried to boost far-right Republican candidates whom they deemed easier to beat in November. The strategy seems to have paid off.

TITLE: The U.S. will field one of its youngest teams ever at this year's FIFA World Cup
SUMMARY: In its 26-man roster, the U.S. men's national team is leaning on Christian Pulisic and other young stars as it looks to turn the page from its shocking failure to qualify for the 2018 tournament.

TITLE: A piece of the wrecked 1986 Challenger space shuttle was found off Florida's coast
SUMMARY: A documentary crew with the History Channel initially made the discovery during a dive looking for World War II-era wreckage.

TITLE: In one first-grade classroom, puppets teach children to 'shake out the yuck'
SUMMARY: A new program being piloted in a handful of Connecticut classrooms, called Feel Your Best Self, is using the joy of puppetry to teach children how to manage their feelings and empathize with others.

TITLE: Arizona Senate race still undecided as election officials release more ballots
SUMMARY: Three states are left to decide the balance of power Senate. Here's what's happening in Arizona.

TITLE: What the 2022 midterms mean for Biden's presidency
SUMMARY: President Biden's job just got tougher. The midterm election results mean Republicans likely will control the House. But there are some political silver linings in divided government.

TITLE: China eases its 'zero COVID' policy with shorter quarantines and less restrictions
SUMMARY: Authorities in Beijing ease — but don't end — COVID control policies that have kept case counts low but hurt the Chinese economy,

TITLE: Food insecurity is driving women in Africa into sex work, increasing HIV risk
SUMMARY: A study found that giving direct food support to women and girls in sub-Saharan Africa cut their risk of contracting HIV by 64%, because it alleviated the pressure to engage in high-risk sex.

TITLE: NFL's Washington Commanders are among those sued by D.C., accused of deceiving fans
SUMMARY: Owner Dan Snyder and the NFL were among those sued by the District of Columbia, accused of lying about an inquiry into sexual misconduct and a persistently hostile work environment within the team.

TITLE: Residents near the North Pole look on the bright side of seasonal darkness
SUMMARY: On a cluster of islands between Norway and the North Pole, everyone wears headlamps for two-and-a-half months out of the year because it's pitch black outside. This weekend, the darkness begins.

TITLE: Russia says it has fully withdrawn from Kherson, in a major blow to Putin
SUMMARY: Russia announced its plan to pull out of the once-occupied southern Ukrainian city earlier this week.

TITLE: Control of Congress matters. But which party now runs your state might matter more
SUMMARY: In state-level races, Democrats defied expectations, but Republican incumbents held their ground. On the whole, red states continue to grow redder, and blue ones bluer.

TITLE: FTX crypto exchange, billions of dollars low and under DOJ scrutiny, seeks bankruptcy
SUMMARY: FTX had agreed earlier this week to sell itself to bigger rival Binance after experiencing the cryptocurrency equivalent of a bank run. The Department of Justice and the SEC are investigating.

TITLE: Ukrainian troops enter Kherson city after Russia retreats
SUMMARY: Ukraine's defense intelligence agency says its military entered Kherson following Russia's withdrawal from the strategic southern city.

TITLE: Biden says U.S. will rise to the global challenge of climate change
SUMMARY: The President said the United States is cutting its greenhouse gas emissions, and promised again to give more money to developing countries on the front lines of climate change.

TITLE: Biden tightens methane emissions rules, even as the U.S. pushes for more oil drilling
SUMMARY: Oil and gas production is the nation's largest industrial source of methane, the main component of natural gas, and is a key target for the Biden administration as it seeks to combat climate change.

TITLE: New omicron subvariants now dominant in the U.S., raising fears of a winter surge
SUMMARY: Step aside, BA.5. The new variants BQ.1 and BQ.1.1, appear to be among the most adept yet at evading immunity from previous infection and vaccination.

TITLE: 'Fresh Air' honors veterans with interviews with 2 men who served in WWII
SUMMARY: Infantryman Robert Kotlowitz was one of only three in his platoon to survive an ill-advised attack on the Germans. Robert Williams served with the Tuskegee Airmen. <em>Originally broadcast in '99 and '95.

TITLE: A Seoul police officer, under investigation after the crowd crush, is found dead
SUMMARY: The 55-year-old intelligence officer, identified only by his surname Jeong, had been accused of destroying evidence that police knew of the risk but took few measures to control the massive crowd.

TITLE: Voter behavior and election rules contribute to slower counting in Arizona
SUMMARY: One big reason: Arizona voters dropped off hundreds of thousands of mail ballots on Election Day. Now comes the arduous task of processing and tallying those ballots.

TITLE: China eases its 'zero COVID' policy with shorter quarantines and fewer restrictions
SUMMARY: Authorities in Beijing ease — but don't end — COVID-19 control policies that have kept case counts low but hurt the Chinese economy.

TITLE: Saint-Louis is being swallowed by the sea. Residents are bracing for a new reality
SUMMARY: The problem is as simple as it is devastating: the Atlantic Ocean is expanding into Senegal, and Saint-Louis is ground zero. Every year, the island loses a little bit of land to the sea.

TITLE: France accepts a migrant rescue ship as relations sour with Italy
SUMMARY: France allowed the Ocean Viking humanitarian ship to dock in the port of Toulon on Friday, after Italy's new far-right government refused to accept it. More than 200 migrants were aboard the ship.

TITLE: Las Vegas-area GOP Sheriff Joe Lombardo beats Nevada's incumbent Gov. Steve Sisolak
SUMMARY: Nevada's Democratic leader, Steve Sisolak, is the only governor to lose reelection so far this Nov. Joe Lombardo, a Republican, beat Sisolak in a state thought to be trending bluer.

TITLE: Democrat Mark Kelly keeps Senate seat over Trump-endorsed Blake Masters in Arizona
SUMMARY: In bid for continued Senate majority, Democrat Sen. Mark Kelly wins re-election over Trump-backed Republican candidate Blake Masters.

TITLE: Nevada Democrat Rep. Susie Lee wins reelection to U.S. House
SUMMARY: Democratic Rep. Susie Lee has won reelection in Nevada's 3rd Congressional District, beating her challenger, Republican April Becker, in one of the most competitive House seats this cycle.

TITLE: Nevada Democrat Rep. Dina Titus wins reelection to U.S. House
SUMMARY: Democratic Rep. <a href="https://www.rollcall.com/members/25546?utm_source=memberLinks&utm_medium=memberlinks&personid=25546">Dina Titus

TITLE: Adrian Fontes is elected Arizona secretary of state, beating election denier Finchem
SUMMARY: The Democrat narrowly beat Republican Mark Finchem, who has falsely called the 2020 election "irredeemably compromised."

TITLE: Gallagher the watermelon-smashing comedian has died at 76
SUMMARY: The man born Leo Anthony Gallagher Jr. built a nationwide following in the 1970s and '80s. He became increasingly controversial in recent years, chastised for racist and homophobic remarks.

TITLE: Alec Baldwin sues to 'clear his name' in movie set killing
SUMMARY: Baldwin on Friday sued people involved in handling and supplying the loaded gun that he was using when it fired, killing cinematographer Halyna Hutchins during a 2021 filming accident in New Mexico.

TITLE: Here's what's at stake in Monday's meeting between Biden and China's Xi Jinping
SUMMARY: The meeting at the G20 in Indonesia will be their first in person since President Biden took office. Whether they can find common ground is a key question, and reflects the current state of relations.

TITLE: Maya Lin doesn't like the spotlight — but the Smithsonian is shining a light on her
SUMMARY: Heavily criticized 40 years ago for her Vietnam Veterans' Memorial design, the artist-architect-activist prefers to talk about her artistic process rather than her life

TITLE: Women's work is never done: a trio of art books showcasing women
SUMMARY: Three new art books feature female subjects of every shape and hue from all over the world, doing the things that women have historically done — and also the things that men have historically done.

TITLE: Biden pledges the U.S. will work with southeast Asian nations
SUMMARY: Biden's efforts at this year's ASEAN summit are meant to lay the groundwork for his highly anticipated face-to-face meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday.

TITLE: Medieval Times performers in California unionize following months of debate
SUMMARY: The 27-18 vote follows the unionization of performers at the Medieval Times New Jersey location in July.

TITLE: Climate prize winner empowers women in India to become farmers and entrepreneurs
SUMMARY: The group Swayam Shikshan Prayog, which will be recognized today at the U.N. COP27 summit, focuses on the restoration of livelihoods, especially for women, amid the negative impacts of climate change.

TITLE: A new Banksy mural adorns a destroyed building in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Banksy's work, which the artist posted on Instagram Friday to 11.2 million followers, features a gymnast balancing on a pile of rubble with her hands.

TITLE: Trump sues the Jan. 6 House committee to avoid a subpoena
SUMMARY: The lawsuit contends that while former presidents have voluntarily agreed to provide testimony or documents in response to congressional subpoenas in the past, none "has ever been compelled to do so."

TITLE: A giant Christmas tree is once again raised at New York City's Rockefeller Plaza
SUMMARY: In a sign of the season, a crane hoisted an 82-foot Norway spruce into place at New York City's Rockefeller Plaza. The Christmas tree will be officially lit on Nov. 30.

TITLE: Two historic military planes collide in a midair incident during a show in Dallas
SUMMARY: It was unclear how many people were on board the aircraft or if anyone on the ground was hurt. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board are launching investigations.

TITLE: Elon Musk says Twitter bankruptcy is possible, but is that likely?
SUMMARY: Twitter regularly loses money. But Elon Musk took on billions in debt to buy the company at a time when online advertising  is slumping. Could bankruptcy be next?

TITLE: The man who inspired 'The Terminal' dies at the airport he long called home
SUMMARY: Merhan Karimi Nasseri died after a heart attack in Terminal 2F at the Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

TITLE: A secretive Space Force plane completed its longest mission yet
SUMMARY: Details about the X-37B's 908 days spent orbiting Earth are scant. But with each new mission, we learn a little bit more about it.

TITLE: Two historic military planes collide and crash during an air show in Dallas
SUMMARY: It was unclear how many people were on board the aircraft or if anyone on the ground was hurt. The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board are launching investigations.

TITLE: Customs and Border Protection head Chris Magnus resigns
SUMMARY: The head of U.S. Customs and Border Protection has resigned as agents encounter record numbers of migrants entering the U.S. from Mexico. Two people told The Associated Press he was forced out.

TITLE: Cisco Aguilar defeats an election denier to become Nevada's secretary of state
SUMMARY: The Democrat Aguilar defeated Trump-backed Republican Jim Marchant, who has long baselessly maintained the 2020 election was stolen.

TITLE: Democrat Catherine Cortez Masto wins Nevada Senate race
SUMMARY: The Democratic incumbent has been elected to represent Nevada in the U.S. Senate, according to the AP.

TITLE: Democrats retain control of the Senate after holding Nevada seat
SUMMARY: The chamber was decided Saturday evening after Nevada Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto defeated Republican nominee Adam Laxalt. That gives Democrats 50 seats.

TITLE: Top U.S. border official Chris Magnus resigns after less than a year on the job
SUMMARY: The head of U.S. Customs and Border Protection has resigned as agents encounter record numbers of migrants entering the U.S. from Mexico.

TITLE: Military leaders from Ethiopia and the Tigray region have agreed on a peace roadmap
SUMMARY: Both parties have agreed to protect civilians and facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid to the region of more than 5 million people, according to a copy of the agreement seen by the AP.

TITLE: The midterms didn't produce a wave. Here's what that's meant historically.
SUMMARY: Historically, first midterms are cold showers for the occupant of the White House.

TITLE: Michael Imperioli is back (after never really going away)
SUMMARY: Michael Imperioli is back in the spotlight. This time around, he's being propelled by a leading role in another HBO show and a fresh wave of cultural relevance for <em>The Sopranos

TITLE: The culture wars are pushing some teachers to leave the classroom
SUMMARY: Teachers and administrators, already facing long hours and low pay, now find themselves under pressure from politicians, parents and even their own school districts.

TITLE: Ash Ketchum becomes the top Pokémon master he always wanted to be 25 years later
SUMMARY: Ash emerged victorious in the Pokémon World Coronation Series in the latest episode of <em>Pokémon Ultimate Journeys: The Series

TITLE: 'It could just sweep us away': This school is on the front lines of climate change
SUMMARY: Climate change is an everyday reality for students and teachers living in the Himalayan mountains of Nepal. At one school, they are trying to learn more about the forces that could upend their lives.

TITLE: Dave Chappelle monologue disappoints on 'Saturday Night Live'
SUMMARY: Chappelle's monologue seemed filled with justification and minimization.

TITLE: An explosion hits a pedestrian avenue in Istanbul. It's unclear how many were killed
SUMMARY: The cause of the explosion was not immediately clear.

TITLE: 6 people are confirmed dead after 2 planes collided mid-air at a Dallas airshow
SUMMARY: News footage from the scene at the Wings over Dallas air show showed the crumpled wreckage of two historic military planes.

TITLE: Nevada voters back big changes to their election system
SUMMARY: The measure establishes open primary elections and then ranked-choice voting. But because it amends the state constitution, voters will need to approve it again in 2024 for it to take effect.

TITLE: Turkey's leader calls the blast in Istanbul an attack. At least 6 are dead
SUMMARY: There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the blast on Istiklal Avenue. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has vowed that the nation will not bow to terrorism.

TITLE: People smugglers keep trying to recruit this boat captain. He keeps refusing
SUMMARY: Years of captaining a boat have shaped Pape Dieye's calm and reassuring presence in Senegal. These qualities have also caught the eye of people hoping to make the dangerous journey to Europe.

TITLE: Turkey calls the blast in Istanbul an attack. At least 6 are dead
SUMMARY: There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the blast on Istiklal Avenue. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has vowed that the nation will not bow to terrorism.

TITLE: A Sandy Hook memorial opens to the public nearly a decade after school tragedy
SUMMARY: The memorial honors the 26 children and adults killed in the 2012 shooting in Newton. A rebuilt Sandy Hook School is now visible from the site in Newton, Conn.

TITLE: Al Gore says a new online platform curbs cheating from world's largest polluters
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Vice President Al Gore about his announcement at the UN Climate Conference, COP27, regarding the launch of the Climate TRACE website.

TITLE: Biden and Xi are meeting in Bali. Here are the high-stakes issues on the agenda
SUMMARY: President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping are holding a high-stakes face-to-face meeting in Bali, Indonesia. Here's what we know so far.

TITLE: Taylor Swift wins big in Germany at the MTV European Music Awards
SUMMARY: Taylor Swift won big at Sunday's MTV European Music Awards. Swift, walking away with multiple wins, including for best artist, best video and best long-form video.

TITLE: Police say 4 University of Idaho students have been found dead near the campus
SUMMARY: Police are investigating the deaths of four University of Idaho students found Sunday in a home near the campus.

TITLE: Rats have rhythm and can keep the beat to Mozart, a new study shows
SUMMARY: Scientists at the University of Tokyo found that rats possess the ability to keep the beat to musical pieces from Mozart.

TITLE: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy makes surprise visit to liberated city of Kherson
SUMMARY: The Ukrainian president appears openly in front of the main government building in the southern city, and speaks to cheering residents who endured eight months of Russian occupation.

TITLE: He has attempted the journey to Europe three times, and refuses to give up
SUMMARY: Mamadou Niang has decided he has no choice but to leave his native Senegal. Salinization has made it impossible to farm his family's land.

TITLE: A censored nude painting from 1616 is set to be digitally unveiled
SUMMARY: Long before Instagram, the male-dominated art world had censorship guidelines of its own. After a cover-up paint job, restorers will create a digital image of Artemisia Gentileschi's original work.

TITLE: What it means that a historic number of LGBTQ candidates won midterm elections
SUMMARY: The 2022 midterm election made history with the most wins for openly LGBTQ candidates. At least 340 candidates have won their races, beating the previous record of 336 in 2020.

TITLE: Ukrainian soldiers who helped liberate Kherson describe relief, joy and apprehension
SUMMARY: Many soldiers from the southern port city of Kherson spent months trying to liberate their homes. The Russian retreat last week was a major blow to Moscow's war effort.

TITLE: Why elections are not over until the votes are certified
SUMMARY: Even after vote counting ends, the midterms are not officially over until the results are certified. Election deniers who don't like the results may try to slow down or stop this step.

TITLE: EXCLUSIVE: Michelle Obama reads from her forthcoming book ' The Light We Carry'
SUMMARY: In a new book, the former first lady focuses on how she's dealt with difficult situations in her life. You can listen to her talk about a couple of these times in exclusive excepts provided to NPR.

TITLE: From science fiction to reality, 'no kill' meat may be coming soon
SUMMARY: The meat of the future may be cultured directly from animal cells without slaughtering livestock. It's not yet sold in the U.S., but NPR got a tour of a leading start-up and a taste of their chicken.

TITLE: Multiple students are dead from Virginia and Idaho university campuses, officials say
SUMMARY: Dual tragedies over the weekend on opposite sides of  the country over the weekend left multiple students dead at the universities of Virginia and Idaho, authorities said.

TITLE: Biden and Xi begin meeting with high stakes issues on the agenda
SUMMARY: President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping are holding a high-stakes face-to-face meeting in Bali, Indonesia. Here's what we know so far.

TITLE: Al Gore helped launch a global emissions tracker that keeps big polluters honest
SUMMARY: The online tool tracks power plants, oil refineries, large ships and other sources of greenhouse gases. Gore plans to expand the tracker to observe every major source of emissions.

TITLE: Police say 4 University of Idaho students were found dead near campus
SUMMARY: Officers discovered the deaths when they responded to a report of an unconscious person in a home near the campus. They called the deaths suspected homicides.

TITLE: We asked, you answered: What precious object is part of your family history?
SUMMARY: Readers responded with moving stories of past journeys and crises — and keepsakes that remind them of their roots and tie them to their family. Here's a sampling of replies.

TITLE: Turkey blames Kurdish group for Istanbul bombing
SUMMARY: Turkish authorities blamed a Kurdish group active in Syria. Turkey views the group as the Syrian affiliate of the Kurdistan Workers Party, which it has been battling for decades.

TITLE: EXCLUSIVE: Michelle Obama reads from her forthcoming book 'The Light We Carry'
SUMMARY: In a new book, the former first lady focuses on how she's dealt with difficult situations in her life. You can listen to her talk about a couple of these times in exclusive excepts provided to NPR.

TITLE: 3 people are dead and the gunman is at large in a University of Virginia shooting
SUMMARY: The University of Virginia is in lockdown as law enforcement officers search the campus for a suspected gunman.

TITLE: Biden and China's Xi met for three hours. Here's what they talked about
SUMMARY: President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping held a high-stakes face-to-face meeting in Bali, Indonesia. Here's what we know so far.
